text:
And these are voices from the other part of the
classroom audience—the students:
“I really dreaded coming into TV English, but
it has proved to be the most interesting and re¬
warding English class of my school career.”
“Mr. Layne seems to bring out something our
regular teachers can’t do. I guess he has more
time to prepare it.”
‘ ‘ My mother likes to watch the telecasts. She says
she learns a lot.”
“My opinion of TV classes is very low. There is
not enough class participation.”
“Because of the excellent outline sheets that are
provided, we are able to grasp more.”
“I asked for thirteen copies of the test given in
Spanish over television. They were for the Span¬
ish class I give in the basement of our house, for
my brothers and sisters and other kids. ’ ’
‘ ‘ This course really forces you to stay on the ball.
The studio teacher moves on each day, and you
must work to keep up with her.”
“I miss the colors and smells in chemistry.”
‘ ‘ The part I’ve enjoyed most is chemistry. I have
read several new science books on my own.”
